ratings.comment: Joe is an excellent professor that provides us with real-world examples to better understand topics. The guest speakers each week really made the class engaging and interesting.

Incredibly smart guy and lectures were always a blast. The online videos are where you learn - in-person lectures were 10% course content and 90% miscellaneous stories. His guest speakers are top-notch and incredibly professionals.

Joe is AWESOME. My favorite class at WSB yet. Go to his office hours and go to his end of semester celebration at the union. 
At a large school he makes students feel like they matter. 

Class isn't that difficult. Go to class and listen to what he says. A large amount of tests are based on EXACTLY what he says during lecture.

Boucher is an awesome law professor and a great guy. His class became the only one that I would consistently go to at the end of the semester. His lectures are captivating and he makes clear difficult concepts by explaining examples of his real-world experiences.

Joe is an interesting guy. His lectures are primarily what you learn, no book necessary unless you're confused. Tests are a bit subjective, but not terrible if you study before and not overthink them. Big short paper was useless. Sometimes seems a bit arrogant, but he is a lawyer. Good class in bus law 2. Pretty easy to get at least an AB

The content of this course is very easy. So most of the times he talks about current matters, everything that he has a say about. Very opinionated person, but it's great to hear from a professional lawyer.

Joe is a good teacher and a great man. My absolute favorite professor from any class at UW. He's clearly an expert on the material he lectures on but more than that, he's an expert at life who communicates his insights masterfully.

Boucher is a decent person who made me laugh most days. However,he sometimes crossed the line when he aired his opinions, and sometimes it was unclear which material was important for exams and which was completely irrelevant.

Boucher is a legend. Phenomenal guy who is down to earth and loves his students. Loves what he teaches, but also brings up current events to make the class fresh. One of the finest adults I have ever met.
Boucher rocks. Great lecturer.  I would look forward to his 30 minutes monologue on current events and life every Tuesday/Thursday.

Great guy, great lecturer. He's a lawyer and he really knows his stuff. Makes the material as interesting as law can be. Opinionated, but in a good way. Likes to talk about current events. Very helpful, willing to meet with you, and genuinely cares about students.
